rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will end in that letter of the alphabet.)

clues.text: In 1897 saplings from Civil War battlefields were planted in a memorial grove in Capitol Park in this city
Tijuana is about 15 miles south of the downtown of this city, "The Birthplace of California"
In 1945 the U.N. was organized in this city built on & around more than 40 hills
Settled in 1882, this city was named for the province in Canada
This city in the foothills of the Santa Cruz Mountains is home to Apple Computer
Murders that might be the work of a vampire haunt "Violets Are Blue", James Patterson's follow-up to this novel
In an Alexandre Dumas novel, the town of Haarlem offers a prize to anyone who can grow a black one of these
This 1987 play about the friendship between a widow & her chauffeur won Alfred Uhry a Pulitzer Prize
In a Daniel Keyes story, the title bouquet is for this lab mouse
Ingrid, in this "pale" tale by Janet Fitch, kills her boyfriend with poison made from the title flower
This country's Maharajas' Express features wi-fi & a luxurious presidential suite that is an entire car
The Canadian is a train that takes a scenic 2,775-mile ride from this Ontario city to Vancouver
In 1981 Amtrak revived the name of this Illinois Central train popularized in an Arlo Guthrie song
The Indian Pacific's route between Sydney & this capital of Western Australia has a record 297 miles of straight track
In 2007, between Paris & Strasbourg, the train known by this French abbrev. hit a record speed on rails at 357 MPH
Kristen Bell hit the Hot 100 with "Do You Want To Build A Snowman?" from this film
Beyonce's 2008 double album was called "I am..." her, said to be Queen Bey's stage persona
Deana Carter covers "State Trooper" on "Badlands", a tribute album to this "stately" Springsteen album
"Vertigo" is from U2's album "How To Dismantle" one of these
Pharrell was executive producer of "Paperwork", a 2014 album by the rapper who goes by these 2 letters
In the ninth circle of Hell in the "Divine Comedy" are these people, like Judas
In the King James Bible, the Ninth Commandment says "Thou shalt not bear false witness against" this person
At the 1824 premiere of this work, the musicians & choir were told to ignore the conductor
Mr. Bumble takes this title Dickens character to live at the main workhouse on his ninth birthday
The ninth Pope of this name served from 1846 to 1878, the longest reign ever
One game is to guess the wedding guest who picked the cheapest item off this list of stuff we need from Macy's
You win Best Cook-- I've had to let out my pants & do this equivalent with my ring
On our honeymoon in Aruba, who can learn the most words in Papiamento & this other official language
One hand of poker to decide if we get a chow or this kind of dog named for an area of Northern Honshu
I win best first anniversary gift with stationary from this company started by a man named Stephen, like the author
"And the Lord set a mark upon" this man, "lest any finding him should kill him"
In Genesis this prized item of Joseph's wardrobe gets taken and dipped in blood
Revelation says that this alliterative object was opened, there was a half-hour hush in heaven
Not just trumpets but "a great shout" brought down the walls of this city
In 1 Kings 3 God tells him, "I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart"
Old Spice is one
To behead
This TV host is descended from a French planter who left Hispaniola for Louisiana
Indifference, or a small unit of soldiers on a mission
A mark of misconduct in your record
A draft of this read "We hold these truths to be sacred & undeniable"
In 1777 Washington complained of soldiers "bare foot & otherwise naked"--not great in December at this location
On Jan. 2, 1776 this body passed the Tory Act, saying lock up "unworthy Americans as... have taken part with our oppressors"
Hearing gunfire at Lexington, this leader of the Sons of Liberty said, "What a glorious morning for America"
Asked what kind of government we got, Benjamin Franklin replied, "A republic..." these 5 words
Professor Gerald Cohen, an expert on word origins, edits a learned journal called "Comments On" this
Your beautician is an expert (we hope) in this, the art & practice of beauty treatment
If your specialty is Lepidoptera, you're an expert in this field
It's the medical branch devoted to the stomach & intestines & their ailments
It's the theological study of "last things"
When it debuted, "The Odd Couple" starred Art Carney & Walter Matthau in these 2 roles
This Jack Black film went to Broadway in 2015, with Alex Brightman as Dewey Finn, who poses as a substitute teacher
This American classic shows everyday life in Grover's Corners, New Hampshire
This Tony-winning musical is based on Alison Bechdel's graphic memoir of growing up in a mortuary
The title character of this Shaw play has joined the Salvation Army, hence her rank

rounds.text: The first words spoken in this 1970 Best Picture Oscar winner are "Ten-hut!" "Be seated"
